409.title: Arbitration -- Continuance Of Contractual Provisions
409.description: Require that the contractual provisions contained in a collective bargaining agreement with certified school teachers and municipal employees would continue until a successor agreement has been reached between the parties

410.title: Remedies
410.description: Authorize the director of the department of labor and training to pursue a complaint on behalf of any employee or job applicant for violations of the state labor laws and to seek appropriate remedies

411.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
411.title: Arbitration Of Labor Controversies
411.description: Create certain rights of arbitration for retired police officers and firefighters

412.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (02/27/2014)
412.title: Outdoor Advertising
412.description: Permit the display of outdoor signs and devices with the appropriate state and municipal agency approval provided that such outdoor advertising conforms and is consistent with the municipal comprehensive plan and zoning requirements

413.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor
413.title: Privatization Of Municipal Services
413.description: Establish a process governing the privatization of municipal services analogous to present chapter 42-148 governing the privatization of state services

414.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
414.title: Nonprofit Dental Service Corporations
414.description: Require nonprofit dental service plan providers to provide notice of any changes relating to coverage under the plan to dentist providing coverage under the plan

416.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
416.title: Healthcare For Children And Pregnant Women
416.description: Provide funding, under the RIte Start Program, for abortions necessary to preserve the life of the mother, or in the case of pregnancies as the result of rape or incest

417.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
417.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers- Rhode Island Public Transit Authority
417.description: Establish a limitation of damages of $100,000 in any tort action filed against the RI Public Transit Authority. This act would permit the general assembly to authorize damages in tort actions in excess of $100,000 by special act.

418.title: Real Estate Brokers And Salespersons
418.description: Provide for the implementation of Title XI of the "Federal Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery & Enforcement Act of 1989".

419.title: Rhode Island Fraternal Code
419.description: Remove the exemption to the provisions of the RI Fraternal Code granted to orders, societies, or associations which admit to membership only persons engaged in one or more crafts or hazardous occupations.

421.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
421.title: Access To Abuse-deterrent Pain Medications
421.description: Prevent health insurance policies, plans or contracts that provide coverage for prescription drugs from requiring a beneficiary to use an opioid drug not indicated by the FDA

422.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
422.title: Model Fair Consumer Contracts Act
422.description: Repeal exemptions to the deceptive trade practices act. This act would create the "Model Fair Consumer Contracts Act" to protect consumers from exploitive contracts

424.last_action: House passed Sub A in concurrence
424.title: Animal Diseases In General
424.description: Allow the director of environmental management to appoint one or more inspectors in the state rather than a commissioner in each county to inquire into the condition of any domestic animal

425.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
425.title: Relating To The Recycling Of Organic Materials By Certain Food Wholesalers, Manufacturers, Supermarkets, And Conference Centers
425.description: Require certain large commercial food scrap generators to divert food residuals to composting facilities

426.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
426.title: Tax Credit For Purchase Of Gun Safe
426.description: Provide a credit against state income taxes due in the maximum amount of $200 for the purchase of a U.L. recognized firearms safe, for the 2014 and 2015 tax years

427.title: Salaries And Traveling Expenses
427.description: Permit state officers and employees to exclude from taxable wages the parking costs associated with the use of community passes

429.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
429.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government
429.description: Create the RI Performance Excellence Program in order to foster a culture to continuously improve the efficiencies of the government workforce

431.title: Personal Income Tax - Historic Homeownership Assistance
431.description: Allow a credit for the maintenance and rehabilitation of historic residences under the Historic Homeownership Assistance Act

432.title: Sanitation In Food Establishments
432.description: Create a new clarification of food businesses entitled instate food processors (wholesale and/or retail) with annual sales less than $50,000 and require these businesses to pay a registration fee of $75.00

433.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
433.title: Milk Sanitation Code
433.description: Require that labels or marks on milk or milk products include information disclosing whether such milk or milk product has been genetically engineered or modified

435.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
435.title: Stroke Prevention And Treatment Act Of 2009
435.description: Expand the methods by which all acute care hospitals prepare for the treatment of stroke patients

438.title: Cruelty
438.description: Specifically make it a misdemeanor to confine any animal in a motor vehicle if it is done in a manner that places the animal in a life or extreme health threatening situation

439.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
439.title: Gambling
439.description: Allow charitable organizations to conduct temporary casino gaming not to exceed a period of four (4) consecutive days, commonly known as a "Las Vegas Night".

443.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
443.title: Statutory Interest
443.description: Decrease from twelve percent (12%) per annum to six (6%) per annum the statutory interest rate added to judicial civil action money damage judgments

444.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
444.title: Judgments, Orders And Decrees -- Interest On Judgments
444.description: Provide that interest on judgments would accrue from the date of the filing of the civil action, not the date the cause of action accrued

445.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
445.title: Conduct Of Elections
445.description: Make extensive changes to the elections laws, including the definition of what a vote is and how to store ballots in cases of disputed results, and would allow a voter to take or use election paraphernalia into a polling place

446.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
446.title: Relating To Towns And Cities
446.description: Establish the RI foreclosed property upkeep act & would require a purchaser of foreclosed property to maintain the property in accordance with the RI housing and maintenance and occupancy code

447.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
447.title: Criminal Record Background Checks
447.description: Make changes to how information contained within criminal background checks made because of employment is disseminated and disclosed

448.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
448.title: Relating To Food And Drugs
448.description: Remove the state's prohibition on adults using, possessing, and cultivating marijuana for personal use

453.title: Relating To Probate Practice And Procedure
453.description: Make several amendments to the statutes regarding rules of descent and would also provide for an elective share to the surviving spouse of a decedent domiciled in this state

455.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
455.title: Assaults
455.description: Require that any sentence imposed for the crime of assault with bodily fluid would run consecutively to, and not concurrently with, any sentence previously imposed

456.title: Internet Service Providers
456.description: Expand the time period that law enforcement officials, who have received internet subscriber acct information & have not instituted arrest/grand jury proceeding/criminal prosecution have between 60 days&75 days to between 100 days&120 days

457.title: Vital Records
457.description: Make technical amendments, removing an obsolete reference to the local or municipal registry of birth records, and update the statute since births are now reported electronically

458.title: Registration
458.description: Eliminate the requirement that farm license plates be renewed annually

459.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
459.title: Fraud And False Dealing
459.description: Criminalize residential mortgage fraud and extend the statute of limitations for the offenses of unlawful appropriation, false financial statement to obtain loan or credit, false statement to obtain a loan, bank fraud and residential mortgage fraud

461.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
461.title: Identity Theft Protection
461.description: Impose additional requirements upon a notice of breach and disclosure to affected Rhode Island residents of the contact information for consumer reporting agencies and the Federal Trade Commission.

462.title: Regulatory Fairness In Administrative Procedures
462.description: Amend the process for submission of economic impact statements, and eliminate a number of exclusions which are set forth in the existing statute

463.title: Health Care Services--utilization Review Act
463.description: Remove the sunset provision from the act that allows the department of health to issue statutory variances from one or more of the specific requirements of the Health Care Services Utilization Review Act.

465.title: Regulation Of Business Practices Among Motor Vehicle Manufacturers, Distributors And Dealers
465.description: Prohibits auto manufacturers from preventing new car dealers from charging fees allowed under law, and also regulates warranty "charge backs" of claims.

466.title: Underground Utility Contractors
466.description: Establish qualifications/procedures to license underground utility contractors. It would also enlarge the contractor's registration and licensing board from fifteen (15) to seventeen (17) members to administer and to oversee the licensees.

470.title: Post Audit Of Accounts
470.description: Allows the bureau of audits to conduct reviews and assessments of government computer systems and security systems designed to protect them.

471.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
471.title: Coverage For Prescription Drugs
471.description: Prohibits health insurance policies which provide for prescription drugs from requiring a beneficiary to use a non-brand name drug prior to using a brand name drug prescribed by a licensed prescriber.

472.title: Casualty Insurance Generally
472.description: Require insurers to send insureds a notice captioned "Insurance Coverage Reduction Notice" itemizing and describing any policy coverage reductions elimination, or increased deductibles not requested by the insureds.

473.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
473.title: Public Utilities Commission
473.description: Require all public utilities to maintain a customer service facility within the state to perform services such as customer inquiries and bill payment.

474.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
474.title: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers
474.description: Require any public utility company providing services to eighty-five percent (85%) of the residents of any city or town to also make available said services to the remaining fifteen percent (15%).

475.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
475.title: Catastrophic Health Insurance Plan Act
475.description: Require a public hearing for all insurers or health maintenance organizations who propose rates for health insurance coverage in the individual market.

476.title: Partnerships
476.description: Change the filing fee for an LLP from $100 for each partner to a flat fee of $150. The renewal application would change from $100 for each partner to a flat fee of $50.

477.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
477.title: Licensing Of Healthcare Facilities
477.description: Cap hospital employees' compensation not to exceed 110% of the northeast regional average, excluding licensed doctors, nurses and health care personnel.

478.title: Self Insurance
478.description: Transfer the responsibility of determining whether an entity qualifies as a self-insurer from the division of motor vehicles to the department of business regulation.

479.title: Health Care Accessibility And Quality Assurance Act
479.description: Provides that health insurers could not require optometrists to provide services at a fee set by the insurer unless the insurer covered the fee.

480.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (04/09/2014)
480.title: Ticket Brokers
480.description: Enact the "Fair Access to Tickets and Ticket Brokers Act" which would regulate the sale and resale of event tickets, and would require registration of ticket brokers with the department of business regulation.

481.title: Claims Adjusters
481.description: Defines and provides for rules, regulations, restrictions and exemptions for the licensure of public adjusters, company adjusters and independent adjusters. Provides for the issuance of emergency licenses during a catastrophe.

482.title: The Rhode Island Energy Efficiency And Resource Management Council
482.description: This act changes the composition of the Rhode Island energy efficiency and resource management council. The council would consist of (13) members versus (11) members who would be appointed by the governor with the advice and consent of the senate.

483.title: Licensing
483.description: Allow funds collected from licensing fees to be used for the acquisition, stewardship, and development of fish and wildlife lands.

485.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
485.title: Fees
485.description: Exempt out-of-state food processers and wholesalers from the five hundred dollar ($500) fee charged food processors, as said processors already pay fees to their respective states to ensure compliance with health laws.

486.title: Cities Of Providence And Warwick And The Town Of Portsmouth--sales Tax On Medical Marijuana
486.description: Authorize the cities of Providence and Warwick, and the town of Portsmouth to enact ordinances providing for a tax of three percent (3%) on the sale of medical marijuana. The funds would be used for substance abuse prevention.

487.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Kingstown To Issue Bonds And Notes To An Amount Not Exceeding $4,900,000 To Finance The Construction Of Sewers And Sewerage Systems In The Town, Primarily For The Wickford Commercial Area, Including The Acquisition Of Land Therefor And Authorizing The Imposition Of Sewer Assessments And User Fees
487.description: Authorizing The Town Of North Kingstown To Issue Bonds And Notes To An Amount Not Exceeding $4,900,000 To Finance The Construction Of Sewers And Sewerage Systems In The Town, Primarily For The Wickford Commercial Area, Including The Acquisition Of Land Therefor And Authorizing The Imposition Of Sewer Assessments And User Fees

488.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Kingstown To Issue Bonds And Notes To An Amount Not Exceeding $6,600,000 To Finance The Construction Of Sewers And Sewerage Systems In The Town, Primarily For Post Road North, Including The Acquisition Of Land Therefor And Authorizing The Imposition Of Sewer Assessments And User Fees
488.description: Authorizing The Town Of North Kingstown To Issue Bonds And Notes To An Amount Not Exceeding $6,600,000 To Finance The Construction Of Sewers And Sewerage Systems In The Town, Primarily For Post Road North, Including The Acquisition Of Land Therefor And Authorizing The Imposition Of Sewer Assessments And User Fees

490.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
490.title: In Amendment Of Chapter 286 Of The Public Laws, 1986, Entitled "in Amendment Of And In Addition To Chapter 55 Of The Public Laws, 1958, Entitled 'authorizing The Towns Of Charlestown And Richmond Together, Or Together With The Town Of Hopkinton, To Join A Regional High School District, Incorporating Said Regional High School District, And Providing For The Issuance Of Bonds, Construction And Operation Of A Regional High School For The Joint Use Of The Participating Towns, Within Said Regional High School District Established By This Act,' As Amended"
490.description: In Amendment Of Chapter 286 Of The Public Laws, 1986, Entitled "in Amendment Of And In Addition To Chapter 55 Of The Public Laws, 1958, Entitled 'authorizing The Towns Of Charlestown And Richmond Together, Or Together With The Town Of Hopkinton, To Join A Regional High School District, Incorporating Said Regional High School District, And Providing For The Issuance Of Bonds, Construction And Operation Of A Regional High School For The Joint Use Of The Participating Towns, Within Said Regional High School District Established By This Act,' As Amended"

491.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
491.title: Auditor General
491.description: Empower the auditor general to conduct investigations within the purview of his/her rights, duties, and responsibilities to conduct investigations, whether the general assembly is in session or not.

492.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
492.title: Permanent Foundation Education Aid
492.description: Revise the provisions providing for funding for transportation of students to the William M. Davies Jr. Career and Technical High School and the Metropolitan Regional Career and Technical Center.

493.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
493.title: Establishing A Program Within The Department Of Human Services To Provide For Emergency Housing Assistance
493.description: Establish an emergency housing assistance fund to be administered by the department of human services in conjunction with community action program agencies.

495.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices And Other State Constructions
495.description: Name the building known as building No. 71 at the John O. Pastore Center the "John J. Wrenn Building".

496.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
496.title: Taxation - Impact Fees
496.description: Create temporary reductions on certain fees and taxes relating to building and construction, specifically permit fees, impact fees and lumber and other building materials.

497.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
497.title: Musical And Theatrical Production Tax Credits
497.description: Add "the development of the performing arts and associated trades" to the state musical and theatrical production tax credits and would define and add certain productions to the definition of an "accredited theater production".

498.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
498.title: Rhode Island Small Business Minority Lending Set-aside Program
498.description: Establishes the RI small business minority lending set-aside program. Provides that approximately 24% of federal SSBCI funds would be set aside for small minority-owned businesses.

499.title: To Improve Early Education Access And Affordability
499.description: This act extends the sunset provision for the child care subsidy transition program within the department of human services from September 30, 2014 to September 30, 2016, a period of two (2) years.

500.title: Adult Education
500.description: Authorize the department of education to waive fees associated with the high school equivalency test and appropriates the sum of two hundred thousand dollars ($200,000) each year commencing July 1, 2014 to cover administrative costs.

503.title: Rhode Island Turnpike And Bridge Authority
503.description: Extend the final date that the Rhode Island turnpike and bridge authority may impose a toll on the Sakonnet River Bridge not to exceed ten cents ($0.10), from April 1, 2014 to May 15, 2014.

505.title: Authorizing The Town Of Narragansett To Finance The Improvement, Renovation, Repair, Reconstruction And/or Restoration Of And Equipment For The Town Of Narragansett Public Safety Building And To Issue Not More Than $2,000,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor
505.description: Authorizing The Town Of Narragansett To Finance The Improvement, Renovation, Repair, Reconstruction And/or Restoration Of And Equipment For The Town Of Narragansett Public Safety Building And To Issue Not More Than $2,000,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor

507.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
507.title: Public Health And Workplace Safety Act
507.description: Require smoking bar owners to register with the division of taxation and quarterly demonstrate that tobacco revenue exceeds combined total of food and beverages.

510.title: Epinephrine
510.description: Significantly regulate the use and acquisition of epinephrine auto-injectors to treat allergic reactions.

511.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
511.title: Hearing Aids
511.description: Increases hearing aid insurance coverage for those under the age of 19 from ($1,500) to full cost, and for those age of 19 and older from ($700) to ($1,500).

512.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils
512.description: Require that for school bus transportation provided to children enrolled in grades kindergarten through six (6), a parent, guardian or authorized person be present at the child’s designated bus stops.

514.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
514.title: Rhode Island Educational Records Bill Of Rights
514.description: Require parental access to information, materials or results relating to state student assessments including instructions, answer sheets and assessment booklets.

517.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
517.title: Safe Firearms Act
517.description: Establishes the Safe Fire Arms Act, regulating the manufacture, sale, possession and transfer of certain assault weapons, with several exceptions.

518.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
518.title: Gun Control And Safe Firearms Act
518.description: Impose restrictions on the manufacture, transfer and possession of certain semiautomatic assault weapons. It would ban large capacity ammunition feed devices.

519.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
519.title: Weapons - Safe Firearms Act
519.description: The act makes possession of magazines holding more than ten rounds unlawful while providing an exemption for military and law enforcement personnel and firearms dealers supplying lawful users. Certain probate transfers are exempted as well.

529.title: Speed Restrictions
529.description: Require drivers to move into a lane that is not the lane nearest parked highway maintenance equipment with flashing lights and to continue in that lane until clear of the equipment.

532.title: Museum Property Act
532.description: Exclude the property of any agency or public body from the provisions of "The Rhode Island Museum Property Act."

533.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
533.title: Electronic Voter Registration
533.description: Authorize the state board of elections to create and administer an electronic voter registration system.

534.title: Public Safety Grants Administration
534.description: Changes the composition of various boards and committees within the RI justice commission and eliminates the requirement that they meet quarterly.

535.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
535.title: Publication Of Interdepartment Real Property Transfers
535.description: Simplify the notice requirement for transfers of property between state agencies and departments.

536.title: Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act
536.description: Create the “Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act” for the purpose of regulating the official publication of legal material in an electronic record.

538.title: Probate Courts
538.description: Changes the guardianship jurisdiction over non-documented, non-citizen minors from the probate court to the family court.

539.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
539.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure
539.description: Make changes to the accounting of witness fees where witnesses are procured through the department of the attorney general or the office of the public defender.

541.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
541.title: Bureau Of Audits
541.description: Grants the state bureau of audits, with the DOA directors approval to issue subpoena for the production of documents and records needed by the audit.

542.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act
542.description: Reduces the number of marijuana plants a cardholder can grow, increases the amount of usable marijuana a cardholder can possess, and requires a cardholder who cultivates to obtain a certificate of cultivation which regulates the cultivation location.

543.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
543.title: Compassion Centers
543.description: Prohibits compassion centers from advertising medical marijuana sales in print, broadcast or as in-person solicitation.

544.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A
544.title: Trafficking Of Persons And Involuntary Servitude
544.description: Clarify the criminal offense of human trafficking. This act would also revise the procedures governing forfeitures of proceeds seized from human trafficking.

545.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
545.title: Mortgage And Foreclosure Sale
545.description: Requires mortgagee to file notice to foreclose and appoint agent for service of process with town clerk. It would require mortgagee to comply with housing codes.

546.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
546.title: Assaults - Health Care Workers And First Responders
546.description: Add health care workers, including hospital employees, home health care workers, EMTs and other first responders, to the class of persons an assault on whom constitutes a felony.

547.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
547.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-fraud And False Dealing
547.description: Makes it a felony to knowingly give to any general assembly member, acting in their official capacity, any statement that is false, erroneous or defective and intended to mislead the member. Also creates a civil cause for the Atty General.

548.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
548.title: Indictments, Informations, And Complaints
548.description: Increase the statute of limitations for unlawful appropriation from three (3) years to ten (10) years.

549.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
549.title: Reporting Of Political Contributions By State Vendors
549.description: Prohibit state vendors from making political contributions to candidates for the office responsible for awarding contracts.

550.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
550.title: Crime Against The Public Trust
550.description: Creates new crimes against public trust with 10 year criminal statute of limitations to authorize the possible pension revocation or reduction for any job related felony.

551.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses And Misappropriation
551.description: Create a crime for the larceny of farm products that is either a misdemeanor or a felony depending on the value of the item stolen.

554.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
554.title: Hearing Aid Dealers And Fitters
554.description: Prohibit the sale and/or delivery of hearing aids through the internet or direct mail, and would provide for criminal penalties for violations.

557.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
557.title: Public Drinking Water Supply
557.description: Mandate the classification of real estate as commercial, industrial, or residential by using the classification of said property as determined by the tax assessor's office of the municipality.

558.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
558.title: Public Drinking Water Supply System Protection
558.description: Repeal the provision of the general laws that requires water suppliers that service the town of Johnston to formulate and carry out a program for installation of radio frequency reading systems.

559.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
559.title: Low And Moderate Income Housing
559.description: Allow mobile and manufactured homes which are a part of a mobile and manufactured home park to be counted as low and moderate income housing for purposes of compliance with the requirements of the city or town's comprehensive land use plan.

564.title: Municipal Employees Arbitration
564.description: Prevents a municipality that has local pension plan in critical status and in need of a funding improvement plan from entering into a labor contract longer than 5 years.

565.title: State Building Code
565.description: Require the local building official to examine all applications for permits or amendments thereto within thirty (30) days of filing and either issue the permit or reject it in writing stating the reasons for rejection.

566.title: Veterans' Affairs
566.description: Add the adjutant general of the Rhode Island National Guard or his or her designee as a member of the Rhode Island Veterans' services strategic plan advisory committee.

567.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
567.title: Insurance Benefits
567.description: Provides that adjunct faculty who teach at least 50% of the hours regularly worked by full-time faculty in a given semester would be eligible for the same health benefits as other state employees.

568.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
568.title: Prescription Drug Benefits
568.description: Regulates business dealings between pharmacy service providers and group health insurers, hospitals and HMOs, including costs and substitutions protocols.

570.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
570.title: Cancellation Of Policies
570.description: Require employers to furnish employees notice of cancellation or discontinuation of health insurance by certified mail and would also establish a fine of one thousand dollars ($1,000) for each violation.

571.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
571.title: Cancelling Of Health Insurance Policies
571.description: Prohibit Rhode Island health insurers from altering or cancelling health benefit policies issued prior to the end of the contract.

572.title: Relating To Financial Institutions
572.description: Amend various state banking laws (including, but not limited to, those relating to licensing, bonding and fee structuring) to remove antiquated provisions, and to alleviate unnecessary regulatory burdens.

574.title: Boxing And Wrestling
574.description: Transfer the regulatory and administrative duties for Mixed Martial Arts and Boxing and Wrestling from the Division of Racing and Athletics to the Department of Business Regulation.

575.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
575.title: Gender Discrimination
575.description: Prohibit discrimination by nursing facilities, assisted living residences, home nursing care providers and home care providers on the basis of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

576.title: Drivers Of Taxicabs, Limited Public Motor Vehicles And Public Motor Vehicles
576.description: Require anyone seeking the issuance or renewal of a hackney operator's license for the purpose of driving a taxicab, limited public motor vehicle, or public motor vehicle to undergo a national and state criminal background check.

577.title: Department Of Administration
577.description: Add the executive director of the Coastal Resources Management Council to the state planning council.

578.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
578.title: Geoengineering
578.description: Defines geoengineering as attempts to effect climate change and requires DEM approval, after public hearings, for such efforts.

581.title: School Funds And Property - Department Audit
581.description: Mandate each school department undergo an audit every ten (10) years.

582.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
582.title: Public Assistance-fraud Prevention
582.description: Requires the issuance of EBT cards with photographs of cardholders between the ages of 18 and 60 and not disabled or a victim of domestic violence. It creates abuse reduction measures.

583.title: The Rhode Island Health Benefits Exchange Funding Act
583.description: Requires Health Benefit Exchange operating costs be assessed to insurers issuing policies through the exchange based upon amount of insurance written by the insurer.

584.title: Vocational Rehabilitation For The Disabled
584.description: Lower the minimum acceptable ratio of severely disabled employees that a habilitation facility must employ from sixty percent (60%) to forty percent (40%).

585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
585.title: Motor Fuel Tax
585.description: Allocate $0.0021 of the 1% per gallon environmental fee to the department of human services elderly/disabled transportation program, $0.0079 to the RIPTA elderly/disabled transportation program.

586.title: Tax Incentives For Capital Investment In Small Businesses
586.description: Provides tax incentives and wage credits to venture capital funds and angel investors to promote the development of small businesses in RI.

587.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
587.title: State Police
587.description: Provide that any member of the state police who has completed their service time would be eligible to retire.

589.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
589.title: Secretary Of Education
589.description: Establish an executive office of education headed by a secretary of education, for the purpose of overall management of the public education system.

590.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
590.title: Dogs
590.description: Requires sheltering and nourishment of dogs conform to standards by Tufts Animal Care and Conditions Scale regarding conditions and sets penalties for violations.

592.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
592.title: The Paul W. Crowley Rhode Island Student Investment Initiative - Notice Provisions
592.description: Prevent a state assessment from being used to determine whether a student will graduate from high school and requires parent(s) be notified about a student's lack of proficiency.

595.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
595.title: Mental Health Law
595.description: Align the appointment process for mental health advocate with that of the child advocate.

596.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions
596.description: Change the definition of "simple reading magnifying glasses" to exclude lenses of over plus 3.25 diopters or equivalent magnification.

597.title: Assisted Living Residence Licensing Act
597.description: Require assisted living residences to post in public area a copy of its license and other required information.

598.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
598.title: Homeless Bill Of Rights
598.description: Create the Protection of Homeless Act designed to provide various rights for homeless persons and set certain standards for homeless shelters.

599.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
599.title: Administrative Procedures
599.description: Requires state departments to timely promulgate rules and regulations and requires the oversight committee to record rules and regulations from state agencies.

601.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
601.title: Motor Vehicle Offenses--ignition Interlock Systems
601.description: Grants judges and magistrates the authority, and in some cases require judges and magistrates, to prohibit drivers adjudicated of certain motor vehicle offenses from operating a motor vehicle that is not equipped with an ignition interlock system.

603.title: Trespass And Actions For Possession
603.description: Allow the owner of open space land or holder of a conservation easement or the attorney general to bring an action in superior court to prevent further encroachment of the land and to recover damages resulting from this encroachment.

604.title: Abandoned Mobile And Manufactured Home Act
604.description: Provide a procedure for removal of abandoned mobile or manufactured homes under the jurisdiction of the district court.

606.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
606.title: Uniform Adult Guardianship And Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act
606.description: Create the "Uniform Adult Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act" to encourage computer, communication and assistance between various courts.

607.title: Explosives And Fireworks
607.description: Make it illegal to possess bomb-making ingredients and would create criminal violations for the possession of bombs and bomb-making ingredients by distinguishing them from illegal fireworks.

608.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
608.title: License For Motorcycles
608.description: Provide landowners who allow private property to be used for a motorcycle safety education program with civil immunity.

609.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
609.title: Procedure Generally - Levy And Sale On Execution
609.description: Extends the "homestead exemption" to personal property such as a mobile home used as a residence and makes homestead exemptions subordinate to mortgages without the need for lenders to obtain releases from owners.

614.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
614.title: Minimum Wage
614.description: Raise the minimum wage to nine dollars and twenty-five cents ($9.25) an hour starting in 2015.

615.title: Rhode Island Human Resource Investment Council
615.description: Increase the membership composition of the state career pathways task force from fifteen (15) members to seventeen (17) members.

617.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor
617.title: Employment Security
617.description: Permit the director of the department of labor and training to release information to the department of corrections.

618.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
618.title: Manufacturing And Commercial Exemption
618.description: Permit the cities or towns to establish tax exemptions for industrial and commercial property.

620.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
620.title: Local Taxes
620.description: Make changes in the classification of taxable property for local taxation purposes.

624.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
624.title: Termination Of Service To Persons Who Are Disabled And Seriously Ill
624.description: Prevent termination of gas or electric service in any residence where the income is at or below eligibility guideline from November 1 to May 1.

626.title: In Amendment Of Of The Public Laws Of 1959 Entitled "in Amendment Of An Act, Entitled 'to Incorporate Certain Persons By The Name Of The Rhode Island Episcopal Convention,' Passed At The January Session 1844, And Of Several Acts In Amendment Thereof And In Addition Thereto"
626.description: Amends the public laws of 1959, entitled "to incorporate certain persons by name of the RI Episcopal Convention; passed -- January session 1844, and of several acts in amendment thereof and in addition thereto"

627.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities
627.description: Requires excavators to provide additional specific information regarding any excavation location to the PUC. Provisions are included for violations.

628.title: The Standard Nonforfeiture Law For Life Insurance
628.description: Provides technical changes to life insurance standard valuation and non-forfeiture provisions, allows for the electronic filing of annual reports and eliminates the need of third-party administrator verification of annual report by 2 officers.

629.title: Automobile Body Repair Shops
629.description: Creates 2 license classifications for auto body shop repair facilities. Requires the state to conduct labor rate surveys for each classifications.

630.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
630.title: Use Of Telemedicine Healthcare Modernization Act
630.description: Authorize the provision of healthcare services by "telemedicine", as therein defined, on the same basis as face-to-face consultation, where appropriate, and require healthcare insurers to adjust their coverage protocols accordingly.

631.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
631.title: Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
631.description: Provide a process for issuance of a farmer-brewer license.

632.title: Electricians And Plumbers
632.description: Adjusts the electrical and plumbing license rules for renewable energy installations and creates a renewal energy contractor certificate issued to contractors with a national or equivalent certification in renewable energy installations.

634.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
634.title: Small Employer Health Insurance Availability Act
634.description: Exempt city or town agencies, authorities, or entities, whether collectively or individually, from the definition of "small employer" as it pertains to the Small Employer Health Insurance Availability Act.

635.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
635.title: Distributed Generation Standard Contracts
635.description: Make a number of definitional and time-line changes to the provisions of the Distributed Generation Standard Contracts Act.

636.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
636.title: The Rhode Island Cesspool Act Of 2007
636.description: Phase out the use of cesspools in the state, beginning with those close to tidal water areas and public drinking water supplies and require the identification and replacement of cesspools on all properties that are subject to sale and transfer.

637.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
637.title: Renewable Energy Facilities
637.description: Provide for the siting and operating standards for farm based renewable energy facilities.

638.title: The Distributed Generation Growth Program
638.description: Create a tariff-based renewable energy distributed generation financing program.

639.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
639.title: Relating To State Budget
639.description: Require that the governor submit a zero based budget to the general assembly. The zero based budget shall be phased in over a five (5) year period.

640.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
640.title: Jumpstart Ri
640.description: Establish the JUMPSTART RI program which would award tax benefits to new businesses eligible for this program.

641.title: State Lottery
641.description: Require the lottery director to offset from lottery winnings in excess of six hundred dollars ($600), money owed to the executive office of health and human services for medical assistance overpayments.

642.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
642.title: Retirement System - Contribution And Benefits
642.description: Include the deputy sheriff, capitol police, and DEM police within the department of public safety, as it relates to retirement on service allowances.

643.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
643.title: Medical Assistance - Long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
643.description: Increases the reimbursement rate for certain Medicaid home health and day health providers by requiring a 10% increase to the base rate.

646.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
646.title: Rhode Island Housing Resources Act Of 1998
646.description: Appropriate three million four hundred thousand dollars ($3,400,000) for the housing rental subsidy program and four hundred thirty-nine thousand dollars ($439,000) for homeless prevention and assistance.

647.title: Child Care State Subsidies
647.description: Increase the state subsidies for child care services by forty-two dollars ($42.00) per week.

648.title: Child Care - State Subsidies
648.description: Provides that the department of human services establish increased rates of compensation for certain child care providers and centers with national child care accreditation.

649.title: Relating To Human Services-child Care-state Subsidies
649.description: Establishes a no cost online database at DOH available to child care providers to monitor co-payments due from families receiving assistance with access available to providers not receiving assistance payments for a fee.

650.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
650.title: Combined Reporting
650.description: Address the factors required to be taken into account in determining the taxpayers share of the net business income or loss apportionable to the state of Rhode Island.

652.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
652.title: Residential Renewable Energy System Tax Credit
652.description: Allow the residential renewable energy system tax credit to be carried over the next year or up to three (3) years maximum.

653.title: Taxation Relief From Premium-based Taxation Of Healthcare Services
653.description: Replaces the current immunization/children healthcare services assessments and premium taxes imposed on health insurance companies with a healthcare services surcharge calculated to generate the same amount of revenue as the assessments and taxes.

654.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
654.title: Interest On Delinquent Payments
654.description: Lower the minimum interest rate to be charged on delinquent tax payments from eighteen percent (18%) to four percent (4%).

657.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
657.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act - School Funding Formula
657.description: Freeze the amount of education aid for local school agencies that are scheduled to receive less aid under the funding formula. The education aid would be frozen at the rate provided in fiscal year 2014 for a period of three years.

661.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes - Liability And Computation
661.description: Repeal the estate tax for all probate estates filed on or after January 1, 2015 as well as all provisions relating to enforcement and collection thereof.

663.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
663.title: Location Of Schools In Proximity
663.description: Prohibit the location of new schools in proximity to alcohol sales license holders.

664.title: Ambulance Service Coordinating Advisory Board
664.description: Increases the membership of the ambulance service coordinating advisory board from 23 to 25 members with the two new members being recommended by the president of the senate and the speaker of the house of representatives.

665.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
665.title: Nurses
665.description: Provides that the signature of a certified nurse practitioner or physician assistant be accepted when a doctor signature is required.

666.title: Establishment Of Charter Public Schools
666.description: Defines "virtual schooling" and prohibits the establishment of new charter schools which include virtual schooling as a component of instruction. The prohibition shall expire on June 30, 2017.

667.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
667.title: Professional Development
667.description: Provide for professional development opportunities relating to reading disabilities and would require two (2) hours of professional development instruction pertaining to reading disabilities for certain general education teachers.

669.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
669.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions-pharmacies
669.description: Include "clinical pharmacist practitioners" within the definition of "practitioner" for purposes of presenting drugs.

670.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
670.title: Children
670.description: Increase the minimum age to buy and sell tobacco products from eighteen (18) years to twenty-one (21) years.

673.title: Capitol Police Officers' Powers
673.description: Enables capital police officers to exercise their full authority and powers when assigned to buildings used by a state agency or court for public meetings or hearings.

674.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-child Safe Zones
674.description: Create child safe zones where sex offenders whose victim was a minor are prohibited from being employed. This act also prohibits a sex offender whose victim was a minor from owning or operating a entity that is a child safe zone.

677.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
677.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment, And Supplies

678.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
678.title: Employment Security - General Provisions
678.description: Exclude any "prevailing wage" benefits from the employer's wage base used to calculate its unemployment fund contribution.

679.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
679.title: Workers' Compensation - Benefits
679.description: Exclude any "prevailing wage" benefits from the workers' wage base used to calculate workers' compensation.

680.title: General Powers
680.description: Authorize the town of Richmond to enact an ordinance providing for the registration of businesses in the town. The act would also provide a fine of up to ($25.00) per month for failing to register, not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300.00).

682.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
682.title: Procedure Generally - Governmental Tort Liability
682.description: Restrict the tort liability of city, town or fire district employees or officials to those acts or omissions not performed within the scope of their employment or if actual fraud, malice or willful misconduct is involved.

683.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
683.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Contributions Among Joint Tortfeasors
683.description: Require that a tortfeasor's share of a judgment be bourne by all parties to the action in accordance with their pro rata share of culpability whenever a tortfeasor is found to be unable to satisfy their share.

686.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
686.title: Driving Under The Influence
686.description: Allow the court and the college or university involved in providing drive re-training courses to set the fee for this course.

687.title: Relating To Fish And Wildlife
687.description: Authorizes the DEM director to issue special permits for taking, handling and/or possession of wild animals, notwithstanding the prohibition of silencers and loaded weapons in vehicles.

688.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
688.title: Relating To Insurance
688.description: Repeal the provisions of the general laws that prohibit health insurance coverage for induced abortions for all contracts including those policies covering state and municipal employees.

690.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
690.title: Relating To Justices Of Supreme, Superior, And Family Courts
690.description: Repeal the section of the law concerning retirement of judges with general assembly or office service.

691.title: Contracting Standard For Renewable Energy
691.description: Allow the public utilities commission ninety (90) days to approve or reject long-term renewable energy contracts. The act would eliminate the forty-five (45) day hearing deadline.

692.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
692.title: Rhode Island Business Corporations Act
692.description: Clarify the distinction between dissolution of a corporation and revocation of its charter and the results of such events.

693.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
693.title: Health Insurance - Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies
693.description: Prohibits health care entities and plans from denying payment for medically necessary hospital services, resulting from emergency admission, on sole basis of untimely notice that service was provided.

694.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
694.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists And Estheticians
694.description: Eliminate the requirement that all shops that provide barber, hairdresser, cosmetic therapy, manicures and esthetic services, have on duty at all times a licensed proprietor or licensed barber, hairdresser or cosmetician.

696.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
696.title: Long-term Contracting Standard For Renewable Energy
696.description: Requires that the public utilities commission biannually review power purchase contracts calling for the local construction or installation of generation infrastructure and further require a cost benefit analysis of said contracts.

697.title: Title Insurers Issuing Closing Or Settlement Protection
697.description: Permit title insurance companies and their agents to issue closing funds protection insurance on residential property closings for property consisting of four (4) units or less.

699.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
699.title: Electronic Confirmation And Compliance System
699.description: Creates an electronic automobile and commercial vehicle liability insurance confirmation and compliance system. The act would also establish mandatory fines for operating a vehicle without evidence of registration and financial security.

700.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
700.title: Casualty Insurance Rating
700.description: Eliminate the process that allows filings by casualty insurers seeking rate increases or decreases of not more than five percent (5%) to become effective when filed.

701.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
701.title: Automobile Body Repair Shop Licenses
701.description: Creates 2 different license classifications for auto body repair shop facilities. It would also require the state to conduct separate and distinct labor rate surveys based upon the type of license classifications held by the auto body repair facility.

702.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
702.title: Co-insurance And Deductibles
702.description: Direct the health insurance commissioner to require health insurers to recover all co-insurance and deductible amounts due from patients for covered services as required under the insured's health benefit plan.

703.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
703.title: Department Of Environmental Management
703.description: Require the director of environmental management to implement various new policies to improve service for customers.

704.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
704.title: Minimum Energy And Water Efficiency Standards
704.description: Set specific, up-to-date standards for selected commercial and residential products. These energy and water efficiency standards are based on ENERGY STAR specifications or on standards adopted by various states.

705.title: Quonset Development Corporation
705.description: Authorize the Quonset Development Corporation to establish a stormwater management and conveyance system and regulate connections, user fees, charges and assessments.

706.title: To Create And Establish The Tiverton Wastewater District
706.description: Create and establish the Tiverton Wastewater District.

707.title: Retirement System--contribution And Benefits
707.description: Enact and codify changes to the employees' retirement system, based upon a settlement of litigation between the state and various public employees' unions.

708.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
708.title: Lead Poisoning Prevention Act
708.description: Provide for special legislative funding to the department of health to support the state's environmental lead program.

709.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
709.title: Board Of Governors For Higher Education
709.description: Authorizes the board of governors for higher education to assess a transportation fee of $50.00 to students in state colleges to provide students with RIPTA bus passes.

710.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
710.title: Tobacco Control Program
710.description: Creates a "Tobacco Control Program" to help reduce tobacco use and would increase the tax imposed on cigarettes.

711.title: Child Care Services
711.description: Allow child care providers up to sixty (60) days to submit an invoice to human services for payment for child care services provided and an additional sixty (60) days for the resolution of questions and disputes regarding the invoices.

717.title: Authorizing The Town Of Smithfield To Issue Not Exceeding $6,400,000 General Obligation Bonds Or Notes For The Purposes Of Renovating And Expanding The Smithfield Police Station
717.description: Authorizing The Town Of Smithfield To Issue Not Exceeding $6,400,000 General Obligation Bonds Or Notes For The Purposes Of Renovating And Expanding The Smithfield Police Station

719.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
719.title: Municipal Statnet Program
719.description: Establish a seminar program for state and municipal employees focusing on municipal issues, to be presented by the office of training and development within the department of administration.

720.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
720.title: Rhode Island Municipal Performance Management Program
720.description: Establishes the RI Municipal Performance Management Program funded by the DOA with the goal of improving the delivery of services to government. Requires the funding of a scholarship program to accomplish this goal.

721.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
721.title: The Rhode Island Health Benefits Exchange Act
721.description: Dissolves the RI health benefits exchange effective January 1, 2015 and transfers the management of the exchange to the US department of health.

723.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
723.title: The Rhode Island Healthcare Authority
723.description: Creates the RI healthcare authority to report to the governor and general assembly actions necessary to implement an active purchaser health insurance and health services model to aggregate all funding of such services through HealthSource RI.

724.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
724.title: The Department Of Environmental Management -- Beach Fees
724.description: Establish beach parking rates for the season commencing May 24, 2014, and thereafter.

725.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
725.title: Relating To Naming The Newly Relocated And Reconstructed Winslow Athletic Complex In Warwick
725.description: Name the newly relocated and reconstructed Winslow Field Recreation Complex in Warwick the "Dr. Kathleen Hittner Sports Complex at Winslow Park."

726.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
726.title: Unemployment Management Trust Fund
726.description: Creates Unemployment Management Trust Fund to fund benefit claims and employment and training specialists at DOLT and payment of RI College tuition/costs for unemployed individuals.

728.title: Budget Commission
728.description: Authorizes a city or town council president to appoint a designee to a budget commission so long as the designee is a current city or town council member throughout his or her budget commission term.

729.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
729.title: Alternative Fuel Infrastructure Incentive
729.description: Create tax incentives for the installation of alternative fuel facilities.

730.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
730.title: Uniform Controlled Substances
730.description: Require that any controlled substance sold or dispensed in Rhode Island contain a clearly marked label identifying the country in which the controlled substance was manufactured.

733.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
733.title: Screening For Reading Disabilities
733.description: Require school districts to conduct screening for dyslexia and other reading disabilities of school children who have exhibited one or more potential indicators using certain screening methods selected by the commissioner of education.

734.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
734.title: Multiple Offenses
734.description: Require those who are required to attend driver retraining class for multiple moving offense violations to pay a reasonable tuition to be determined by the court and the college or university administering the course.

735.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
735.title: Hearings
735.description: Provide that the tuition for a rehabilitative driving course would be determined by the judiciary and the institution conducting the course.

736.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
736.title: Textbooks
736.description: Require private schools to purchase and pay for books directly, and to seek reimbursement from the school committee in an amount up to fifty dollars ($50.00) per pupil.

737.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
737.title: Health Maintenance Organizations
737.description: Prohibits a group health plan and health insurance issuer from discriminating regarding participation under the plan or coverage against any health provider acting within scope of provider's license or certification.

738.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
738.title: The Paul W. Crowley Rhode Island Student Investment Initiative
738.description: Establishes mandatory reporting requirements for students k-12 for any assessments of student's performance administered, along with specifics.

739.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
739.title: Board Of Regents For Elementary And Secondary Education
739.description: Directs the board of elementary/secondary education to establish graduation requirements based on holistic assessment of student's readiness for graduation, including the student's record, senior project, portfolio and performance

740.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
740.title: Freedom Of Access To Clinic Entrances And Places Of Religious Worship
740.description: Provide for freedom of access without interference to entrances of clinics as well as places of religious worship.

741.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
741.title: Hunting And Hunting Safety - Nontoxic Ammunition
741.description: Require the use of nontoxic ammunition for hunting purposes whenever such ammunition is available.

743.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
743.title: Evasion Of State Taxes
743.description: Provides civil and criminal penalties for various offenses relating to the evasion of state taxes.

744.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
744.title: Procedure Generally - Fees
744.description: Increase Family Court filing fees by ten dollars ($10.00), which would be transferred to the RI Center for Law and Public Policy. The center would be exempt from filing fees.

746.title: Domestic Violence Prevention Act
746.description: Increase the length of time from six (6) months to one year that one can be in a dating or engagement relationship to qualify as a victim under the domestic violence statute.

749.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
749.title: Relating To Powers Of Fiduciaries
749.description: Permit the settlor of a trust to provide for a person other than the trustee to direct actions of the trustee.

750.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
750.title: Wastewater Treatment Plants
750.description: Require a notice and opportunity to be heard by the public with regard to the permitting of wastewater treatment facilities.

756.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
756.title: Pregnancy Confidentiality Act
756.description: Establishes the "Pregnancy Confidentiality Act" which protects against disclosure of records of any client of a pregnancy resource center.

757.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
757.title: Partial - Birth Abortion
757.description: Amends and revises the definitions and penalties pertaining to partial-birth abortions. Further provides that any physician who knowingly performs a partial-birth abortion would be guilty of a felony and may be liable for civil penalties and fines.

760.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
760.title: Weapons--firearms Act
760.description: Establishes firearm violence prevention fund financed by a $50.00 assessment against persons convicted of firearms offenses.

762.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
762.title: Fur - Bearing Animals
762.description: Allow the killing or trapping of an otter if done in accordance with regulations adopted by the director of the department of environmental management.

763.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
763.title: Birds
763.description: Permit the hunting of migratory game birds by archery equipment including crossbow.

764.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
764.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act - Offenses And Penalties
764.description: Modifies the civil penalty for possession of 1 oz or less of marijuana from $150 fine to not less than $100 or more than $200 per offense.

766.title: Schools
766.description: Make it a violation for a public or private school principal or person in charge to neglect the fire system and fire drill requirements as set out in statute and would increase the fine to two hundred dollars ($200) per violation.

767.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
767.title: Courts - Judicial Selection
767.description: Prohibits members of the judicial nominating commission from engaging in, contributing to, lobbying or influencing political parties, campaigns or offices.

768.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (04/02/2014)
768.title: Superior Court--land Court
768.description: Establish a new and separate calendar within the Superior Court to expediently hear and decide land use matters.

770.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
770.title: Surveillance Devices
770.description: Prohibit surveillance on any public highway in the state unless specifically authorized by statute or court order. This act would also provide for the confidentiality of information collected or stored.

771.title: Financial Exploitation Of Elders And Dependent Persons
771.description: Creates rebuttable presumption of fraud/undue influence for documentary donative transfers by elder/dependent persons to persons in fiduciary, legal, familial, caregiver relationships.

772.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
772.title: Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act
772.description: Adopt "The Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act" which would exempt from civil liability, individuals who administer an opioid antagonist to another person to prevent a drug overdose.

773.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
773.title: Underground Economy And Employee Misclassification Act
773.description: Establish a task force on the underground economy and employee misclassification, prescribe its membership, powers and duties, and provide for annual reports to the general assembly.

774.title: Employment Security - Benefits
774.description: Require employers with more than 25 employees to use the unemployment insurance state information data exchange system to provide information necessary to determine the claimant's benefit rights.

776.title: Low Speed Vehicles
776.description: Permits cities and towns to authorize, by ordinance, the use of low speed vehicles within a certain distance of a golf course.

777.title: Extending The Reporting And Expiration Dates And Amending The Membership Of The Special Legislative Commission To Study Rhode Island's Zoning And Subdivision Enabling Acts
777.description: Extending The Reporting And Expiration Dates And Amending The Membership Of The Special Legislative Commission To Study Rhode Island's Zoning And Subdivision Enabling Acts

778.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
778.title: Comprehensive Fire Safety Act
778.description: Bring various sections relative to fire safety up-to-date relative to the National Fire Prevention Act standards.

782.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
782.title: Relating Health And Safety -- Air Pollution
782.description: Regulate the phase-out of wood stoves without EPA certification in densely populated residential areas.

784.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
784.title: Commerce Corporation--workers' Compensation Subsidy
784.description: Establish a program that offers businesses with ten (10) or less employees a subsidy to assist in the payment of workers' compensation insurance coverage for newly hired apprentices during their first year of employment.

785.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
785.title: Electric Plug-in Drive Vehicles
785.description: Exempt qualified electric plug-in drive vehicles from excise taxes.

787.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
787.title: Equitable Funding For Essential Health Services
787.description: Replaces the current immunization/children's healthcare assessments and premium taxes imposed on healthcare insurers with a healthcare services surcharge calculated to generate the same revenue as the assessments and taxes.

788.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
788.title: Rights And Duties Of Teachers Generally
788.description: Make changes to any educator certification provisions implemented by the department of education.

791.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
791.title: Public Assistance Act -- Medical Assistance And Abortions
791.description: Requires the general public and medical assistance benefits plan recipients, including rape and incest victims, to have their abortions covered.

792.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
792.title: Department Of Attorney General
792.description: Provide the department of attorney general with exclusive jurisdiction and authority to prosecute violations of the Domestic Violence Protection Act.

796.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
796.title: Property Tax Rate For Residential Property Subject To Low Income Housing Covenant Restrictions
796.description: Establish a property tax rate for qualifying residential property subject to certain low income housing covenant restrictions.

798.title: Climate Change - Resilient Rhode Island Act Of 2014
798.description: Creates the Resilient Rhode Island and Climate Change Mitigation and Adaption Acts to provide a comprehensive and coordinated state response to climate change.

799.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
799.title: Tax Sales
799.description: Amend the wording of the statute governing the recording of tax deeds to interface with the statute governing the recording of tax collectors' returns, and would also restore wording inadvertently omitted when the statute was last amended.

800.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
800.title: Relating To The Creation Of A New Fire District In The Town Of Coventry To Be Known As The Main Fire District
800.description: Create and establish the Main Fire District in the Town of Coventry in the jurisdiction of the former Central Coventry Fire District, subject to voter approval.

801.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
801.title: Real Estate Conveyance Tax
801.description: Increase the real estate conveyance tax from two dollars ($2.00) to two dollars and fifty cents ($2.50) per five hundred dollars ($500) of the sale price, and allocates a portion of the increase to the housing resources commission.

802.title: Start-up Rhode Island Tax Free Zone Program
802.description: Establish the "Start-Up Rhode Island Act," which would allow for the creation of tax free zones in the state.

803.title: Lactation Consultant Practice Act Of 2014
803.description: Authorize the director of the department of health to establish rules for the licensing of lactation consultants.

804.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
804.title: Criminal Procedure - Identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
804.description: Grants approved constables the power to serve or execute arrest warrants and body attachments. Expands the powers of the housing courts in the city of Providence and town of North Providence to compel witnesses and punish for contempt.

807.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
807.title: Health Insurance Policies
807.description: Requires every RI hospital or medical expense insurance policy or RI hospital or medical services plan contract after January 1, 2015 to provide coverage for MC5-A scrambler therapy which is nerve pain treatment with electrodes placed on the skin.

808.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
808.title: Department Of Transportation
808.description: Create an economic hardship relief fund from penalties imposed on contractors for past due construction projects to be paid to business owners who can show a decline in revenue as a result of the past due completion of a road or bridge project.

809.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
809.title: Payments To Fire Companies
809.description: Require reimbursement payments from the general fund to volunteer fire departments responding to emergencies along Route 95.

814.title: Apprenticeship Programs In Trade And Industry
814.description: Allows persons honorably discharged from military service, or transferred to reserve status in the National Guard, to use their classroom and workplace training to fulfill the apprenticeship/journey persons requirements for the enumerated skilled trades.

815.title: Employment Security - Benefits - Unemployment Insurance
815.description: Mandates the department of labor and training develop a report that presents options for adjusting and creates state unemployment insurance laws regarding employees, employers, and industries of a seasonal nature, no later than December 1, 2014.

816.title: Employment Security--general Provisions
816.description: Amends the definitions of "credit amount" and "credit week" for purposes of calculating an individual's earned wages, amends the definition of "employment" and indicates that certain services performed by family members not be considered employment.

817.title: Taxicabs And Limited Public Motor Vehicles
817.description: Permit certified taxicab drivers to register charges for transportation services provided to state departments without the use of a taximeter provided the alternate method is approved by the division.

818.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
818.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Abuse
818.description: Require health insurance coverage for drugs which treat opioid substance abuse and addictions. Also requires special discharge plans be developed for patients treated for substance abuse.

821.title: Health Care Services - Utilization Review Act
821.description: Authorize utilization review agent to determine whether to authorize/certify emergency inpatient admissions or admission for residential crisis service treatment of a mental, emotional, or substance abuse disorder.

822.title: Optometrists
822.description: Allows optometrists to prescribe hydrocodone-containing medications despite the classification of hydrocodone as a schedule II Substance. Would also limit the prescription of hydrocodone-containing medications to no more than seventy-two hours.

836.title: Relating To Sales And Use Taxes--liability And Computation
836.description: Exempt the trade-in value of pickup trucks with a gross weight of fourteen thousand pounds (14,000 lbs.) or less from the sales and use tax.

841.title: Payment Of Debts By Contractors
841.description: Subject state public works apprenticeship programs to federal laws and regulation requirements.

842.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
842.title: Rhode Island Behavioral Health Care Reform Act Of 2014
