842.description: Establishes the "Rhode Island Behavioral Health Care Reform Act of 2014," to ensure appropriate behavioral healthcare services are available to people in this state.

846.title: Amending The Charter Of North Providence
846.description: Amending The Charter Of North Providence

847.title: Relating To The Charter Of North Providence
847.description: Relating To The Charter Of North Providence

848.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
848.title: To Create The Smithfield Consolidated Water District And To Provide For Its Powers And Duties
848.description: Merges the Smithfield and East Smithfield Water Districts and creates a 7 member board of directors. The directors would hire the paid staff. Financial obligations would be assumed by the new district. Voter approval would be required.

849.title: Rhode Island Title Insurance Act
849.description: Provide that a title producer who is also an attorney may identify and redact any documents containing privileged materials that are requested by a title insurer in an audit.

850.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
850.title: Medical - Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Abuse
850.description: Permit methadone maintenance services to be included within the definition of "mental illness coverage" for purposes of health insurance coverage.

854.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
854.title: Manufacturing Facilities Tax Credit Act
854.description: Establishes new tax credits as incentives to owners to rehabilitate manufacturing facilities, and to put such facilities into operation.

859.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
859.title: Public Motor Vehicles
859.description: Eliminates the minimum allowable charge for public vehicles when service is prearranged and for when rate is disclosed to passengers in advance.

861.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
861.title: The Coastal Resources Management Council - Fisheries Administrative Fund For Renewable Energy Projects
861.description: Establish a fisheries administrative fund to support commercial and recreational fishing in Rhode Island.

862.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
862.title: Freedom From Life-threatening Physical Restraint Act
862.description: Prevents the use of life-threatening restraints by service providers at covered facilities, requires incident reports if any restraint is used, mandates development of policies/procedures and staff training.

864.title: Licensed Activities
864.description: Requires persons functioning as debt collector for loans or deferred deposit loans and 3rd party loan servicers to seek license from DBR and sets annual fees, capital requirements, bonding amounts and prohibits various practices.

865.title: Public Drinking Supply System Protection
865.description: Require upon dissolution of the board corporate that all existing funds not required for payment of bonds be transferred to the "water resources operating fund."

870.title: Powers And Operations
870.description: Require purchasing of charged-off credit card debt to comply with applicable state and federal law.

871.title: Registration Of Vehicles Containing A Propulsive Battery
871.description: Create a special registration plate for electric powered vehicles.

873.title: Judicial Selection
873.description: Removes the sunset provision for any person who is a candidate for a judicial position and has been nominated by the nominating commission and allows them to remain on the list until June 30, 2015.

874.title: Rhode Island Small Business Minority Lending Program
874.description: Require the commerce corporation to prepare a report by January 15, 2015, to identify options regarding the creation of programs to access capital for small businesses in low, moderate and minority communities.

877.title: Net Metering
877.description: Defines "public entities" for purposes of net metering. Net metering is a process whereby certain electric consumers are permitted to generate electricity and offset their own electric consumption.

878.title: Definitions And General Code Provisions - Types Of Vehicles
878.description: Authorize the division of motor vehicles to issue replica "year of manufacture" plates for antique vehicles.

879.title: Relating To Capital Development Program
879.description: Provide for a bond referendum which would authorize the issuance of bonds for the Roger Williams Park Zoo in the amount of fifteen million dollars ($15,000,000), at the election to be held in November, 2014.

880.title: Retirement System - Contributions And Benefits - Post-retirement Employment
880.description: Increase to 90 days or 180 half-days the time a retired employee may work for a municipality each year without forfeiting pension benefits.

886.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
886.title: Funding Of Public Charter Schools
886.description: Changes the method of determining the local share of per pupil costs for students attending charter schools.

891.title: Automated Traffic Violation Monitoring Systems
891.description: Provide that the state would not require cities or towns to make payments to the state for implementing an automatic traffic violation monitoring systems after July 1, 2015.

893.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
893.title: Domestic Abuse Prevention
893.description: Authorizes police officers to seize weapons from an alleged domestic abuse scene and establishes rules and criteria to govern the possible return of seized weapons, depending on resolution of criminal proceeding, with notice to victim of domestic assault.

894.title: General Powers - Retirement Of Municipal Employees
894.description: Prevent any retired municipal employee convicted of any offense punishable by life in prison from collecting a public pension during his or her period of incarceration.

895.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
895.title: Industrial Property Remediation And Reuse Act
895.description: Provides an exemption for certain so-called "innocent tenants" and property owners of industrial property from liability for costs or damages associated with a release of hazardous materials from the property.

897.title: Collection Of Taxes Generally
897.description: Give the town of Coventry a lien for taxes on mobile or manufactured homes.

899.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Use Disorders
899.description: Require health insurance coverage for drugs which treat opioid substance use and addictions. Also requires special discharge plans be developed for patients treated for substance use.

900.description: Authorizing The Town Of Narragansett To Finance Improvements And/or Related Equipment For The Narragansett Athletic Complex And To Issue Not More Than $1,800,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor

903.title: Justices Of Supreme, Superior, And Family Courts
903.description: Entitles any person who has served in the general assembly, as a general officer, and as a court justice, for at least 20 total years, to receive retirement benefits, if that person retires, resigns and completes service prior to January 1, 2014.

904.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
904.title: Authorizing The Issuance Of Bonds, Refunding Bonds And Temporary Notes In The Total Aggregate Of Thirty Million Dollars
904.description: $30,000,000) FOR THE CULTURAL ARTS AND ECONOMY PROGRAM OF THE STATE (Authorizes issuance of 30 million dollars in bonds, the proceeds to be used for the provision of 1 to 1 matching grants for infrastructure acquisition and improvement at a number of Rhode Island cultural facilities.

905.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
905.title: Student Data-cloud Computing
905.description: Limits the use of student data and information obtained by certain cloud computing service providers. Cloud computing is a service which enables users to store and access certain information via an on-demand network.

906.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (05/07/2014)
906.title: Criminal Intent
906.description: Requires that each element of a criminal offense be considered proven only after criminal intent is established, and be applied in cases where the language of the criminal statute itself doesn't explicitly identify the required criminal intent.

909.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Pontiac Village Association, Inc.
909.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Pontiac Village Association, Inc.

915.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
915.title: The Naturopathic Physicians Act Of 2014
915.description: Establish procedures for the licensing of naturopathic physicians, and defines the practice of naturopathic medicine.

916.title: Body Attachments
916.description: Authorize state licensed constables the power to carry out body attachments.

919.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Lamountain, Inc.
919.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Lamountain, Inc.

922.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,200,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the renovation and reconstruction and equipping of public recreation facilities in the city of Pawtucket.

923.description: Authorize the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $300,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance construction and reconstruction of the sewer and sanitation system in the city of Pawtucket.

927.description: Authorize the city of Cranston to issue not more than $1,200,000 general obligation bonds and temporary notes to finance the improvement, renovation, repair, upgrading and equipping of the public library system in the city.

929.description: Authorize the town of North Smithfield to issue twelve million dollars ($12,000,000) of general obligation bonds and notes in order to finance the repair and rehabilitation of town and school buildings and road infrastructure.

935.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue up to $500,000 in general obligation bonds for traffic control devices.

936.description: Allow a facsimile of the superior court seal to be placed on many court documents.

937.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

937.description: Requires, in some circumstances, a candidate to receive over $100 in in-kind party contributions and make contributions in that amount to his or her campaign, to file only one campaign election report 28 days after the election.

938.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
938.title: Threats And Extortion
938.description: Add court magistrates to the list of covered public officials that are protected from felonious threats.

943.title: Relating To Statutes And Statutory Construction
943.description: This act is the annual statutory construction bill, prepared based upon recommendations of the Law Revision Office. The act would make technical changes and revisions to various general laws.

945.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
945.title: Bail And Recognizance
945.description: Allows a court, when considering bail for a person charged with a sexual offense, to consider past indictments or arrests for similar charges in determining whether the person is a danger to the community.

946.title: Authorizing The City Of Cranston To Finance The Improvement, Renovation, Repair, Alteration And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities In The City By The Issuance Of Not More Than $15,000,000 General Obligation Bonds And Notes Therefor
946.description: Authorizes the city of Cranston to issue not more than $15M general obligation bonds and temporary notes to finance the improvement, renovation, repair, alteration and equipping of schools and school facilities in the city of Cranston.

947.description: Require dry cleaners either to post a list containing the retail price charged for each type of garment except for garments requiring special handling, or to display a printed leaflet or flyer listing these prices in a conspicuous location.

948.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

948.description: Increases maximum fines for alcoholic beverage violations, and provides that a violation be treated as a first violation if no such violation has occurred within 3 years prior thereto.

949.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
949.title: Unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act
949.description: Requires the director of DBR within 30 days of receipt of an insurers response to a written complaint, determine if there is reasonable cause that the insurer is engaging in an unfair claims practice.

950.description: Require that any mobile device communication sold in Rhode Island include a technological solution that will render inoperable the essential features of the device, when the device is not in the possession of the rightful owner.

952.title: Refuse Disposal
952.description: Eliminate the daily amount a C&D facility may receive and process from the definitions and would require such a facility, located within a 1000 radius of a residential zone, conduct all operations within an enclosed structure.

954.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

954.description: Create micro zones in distressed areas to stimulate economic revitalization, employment opportunities, and business development through the redevelopment of obsolete, dilapidated and abandoned industrial and commercial structures.

955.description: Requires notice by the director of labor to the chairman of House Finance, and to employers, of the financial state of the unemployment compensation fund and requires surcharges, if necessary, be paid with the last two quarters payments only.

958.description: Reduce the size of the governor's commission on disabilities from twenty-four (24) members to eighteen (18) members. It would also require that individuals with disabilities be included in its membership when practicable.

959.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

959.description: Creates a cause of action for anyone covered by a fiduciary bond filed due to a probate court order, against the issuing surety for wrongfully, in bad faith, refusing to pay or settle a claim, or perform its bond obligations, including attorney's fees.

960.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

960.description: Protect from public disclosure all individually identifiable evaluations of public school superintendents, administrators, principals, and all other school employees.

961.description: Allows probate estates or administrations to be reopened without probate court approval for the distribution of newly discovered asset(s) ($5,000) or less by executors or administrators and would provide a hearing for any objecting beneficiary.

964.description: Prohibit casinos from attaching the real estate of any person who is providing a casino marker or line of credit by the casino.

965.title: Election Offenses
965.description: Repeals the section of the general laws which provides disclosure requirements pertaining to the author of certain political posters, fliers, and circulars, consistent with the United States Supreme Court decision.

966.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
966.title: Holiday Work
966.description: Allows the exemption to the requirement that employees working Sunday or holiday shifts be paid overtime to apply to limousine and taxi cab companies which operate seven (7) days a week but not twenty-four (24) hours a day.

968.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles
968.description: Authorize municipalities to require parking lots to have a person on site during operational hours to accept cash payments.

969.title: Relating To Amendments To The Charter Of The Exeter Fire District
969.description: Further define the purposes of and the services to be provided by the Exeter Fire District.

972.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities
972.description: Allows currently licensed ambulatory care facilities to provide services at other locations operated by the same facility without having to first obtain an additional license.

973.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
973.title: Conduct Of Election
973.description: Permit a municipality or school district to opt to hold classes on election days; provided that the classes do not disrupt or interfere with the election process.

979.title: Relating To Waters And Navigation
979.description: Underground storage tanks installed prior to May 8, 1988 are permitted to remain in use until December 22, 2020. Five (5) members of the Underground Storage Tank Review Board constitutes a quorum.

982.title: Town Of North Smithfield
982.description: Allow the town of North Smithfield to exempt and stabilize tax assessments for Rankin Estates.

984.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

984.description: Removes home care providers from the requirement of a certificate of need review prior to expansion under determination of need for new healthcare and services act.

987.title: Authorizing The Town Of South Kingstown To Finance Health, Safety, Fire Code And Roof Repairs, Renovations, Improvements, Landscaping, Equipping And Furnishing Of The High School, Middle Schools And Elementary Schools In The Town, And All Attendant Expenses Including, But Not Limited To, Engineering And Architectural Costs By The Issuance Of Not More Than $4,000,000 Bonds, Notes And/or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor
987.description: Authorizes South Kingstown to issue $4,000,000 bonds and notes to finance health, safety, fire code and roof repairs, renovations, improvements, landscaping, equipping and furnishing of the high school, middle schools and elementary schools.

988.description: Authorize the town of South Kingstown to issue not more than $1,000,000 bonds and notes to finance the construction, furnishing, equipping and landscaping of a community recreation center in the town.

996.description: Adds an additional member, the executive director of operation stand down, to the housing resources commission.

1006.description: Authorizes Coventry to $5,500,000 in bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the purchase of equipment and facilities for the automated Town-wide collection, storage and handling of refuse and recyclables in town.

1026.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Derbyshire Woodworking, Inc.

1030.description: OR SAFEGUARDING), REPAIR, REHABILITATION AND CONSOLIDATION OF SCHOOL CLASSROOM AND STORAGE BUILDINGS, INCLUDING HALLIWELL MEMORIAL SCHOOL, NORTH SMITHFIELD ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, NORTH SMITHFIELD MIDDLE SCHOOL, NORTH SMITHFIELD HIGH SCHOOL AND THE ANDREWS SCHOOL, IN ACCORDANCE WITH A PLAN ADOPTED BY THE TOWN COUNCIL BY THE ISSUANCE OF NOT MORE THAN $4,300,000 OF BONDS AND/OR NOTES THEREFOR (Authorizes the town of North Smithfield to issue 4.3 million dollars in general obligation bonds for school buildings.

1031.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Smithfield To Finance The Repair And Rehabilitation Of The Kendal-dean Building, Memorial Town Hall Building And The Municipal Annex To Achieve Efficiencies And The Consolidation Of Municipal And School Administration Functions In Accordance With A Plan Adopted By The Town Council By The Issuance Of Not More Than $5,200,000 Of Bonds And/or Notes Therefor
1031.description: Authorizes North Smithfield to issue $5,200,000 in bonds and notes to finance the repair of the Kendal-Dean Building, Memorial Town Hall and Municipal Annex, in order to consolidate municipal and school administration functions.

1032.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Smithfield To Finance The Repair And Rehabilitation Of Local Road Infrastructure By The Issuance Of Not More Than $2,500,000 Of Bonds And/or Notes Therefor
1032.description: Authorize the town of North Smithfield to issue two million five hundred thousand and 00/100 dollars $2,500,000 of general obligation bonds and notes in order to finance the repair and rehabilitation of local road infrastructure.

1033.title: In Amendment Of Section Vii
1033.description: I) OF CHAPTER 330 OF THE 1991 PUBLIC LAWS ENTITLED "AUTHORIZING THE TOWNS OF BRISTOL AND WARREN TO ESTABLISH A REGIONAL SCHOOL DISTRICT" (This act would allow the Bristol Warren Regional School District to apportion total education cost on a rolling average per pupil calculation over a thirteen (13) year period.

1036.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1036.title: Governor And Lieutenant Governor
1036.description: Provide that candidates for governor and lieutenant governor would run on a joint ticket commencing with the general election in 2018.

1038.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1038.title: Drilling Of Drinking Water Wells Contractors Licensing Law
1038.description: Refines the regulations on drinking water wells to include various types of water supply systems. It also expands the jurisdiction of the contractor's board to include those persons who are authorized to work on water supply systems.

1039.title: Tax Credits
1039.description: Lower the number of seats required for a theater to receive a musical and theatrical production state tax credit from one thousand five hundred (1,500) to one thousand (1,000).

1040.title: Authorizing The Town Of Coventry To Finance The Improvement, Renovation, Furnishing And Equipping Of Parks And Recreation Department Buildings And Facilities And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto By The Issuance Of Not More Than $80,000 Bonds, Notes And/or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor
1040.description: Authorize the town of Coventry to issue $80,000 in bonds to finance parks and recreation facilities.

1041.title: Authorizing The Town Of Coventry To Finance The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Police Station And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto Including Land Acquisition And Demolition By The Issuance Of Not More Than $12,000,000 Bonds, Notes And/or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor
1041.description: Authorizes Coventry to issue not more than $12,000,000 bonds to finance the land acquisition, construction, furnishing, and equipping of a new police station.

1042.title: Higher Education Assistance Authority
1042.description: Authorize the higher education assistance authority and the governor's workforce board to perform a study of the feasibility of establishing a state-administered lifelong learning savings account program.

1043.title: Tax Classification In The Town Of Scituate
1043.description: Authorize the town of Scituate to adopt tax rates for different tax classifications.

1044.title: Authorizing The Town Of Coventry To Finance The Acquisition And Installation Of An Emergency Generator In The Department Of Human Services Building And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto By The Issuance Of Not More Than $80,000 Bonds, Notes And/or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor
1044.description: Authorizes Coventry to issue not more than $80,000 in bonds, to finance the acquisition and installation of an emergency generator in the town's department of human services building.

1045.title: Authorizing The Town Of Coventry To Finance The Design, Construction, Repair, Rehabilitation And Improvement Of Streets, Sidewalks And Bridges In The Town, Including, But Not Limited To, Paving, Drainage, Traffic Control Devices, Road Maintenance Equipment, Safety Improvements And Landscaping By The Issuance Of Not More Than $10,710,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor
1045.description: Authorizes the town of Coventry to issue not more than $10,710,000 in bonds to repair, replace and improvement the town's infrastructure.

1046.title: Renaming The Pocasset River Bridge No. 23
1046.description: Name the Pocasset River Bridge No. 23 as "The Honorable Raymond M. Durfee Bridge."

1047.title: Property Exempt
1047.description: Exempt from taxation the real and personal property of the Pawtucket Youth Soccer Association located at 52 Plain Street within the city of Pawtucket.

1048.title: Itinerant Vendors
1048.description: Repeal the Itinerant Vendors' chapter of the general laws.

1049.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Newbell, Inc.
1049.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Newbell, Inc.

1051.title: In Accordance With Rhode Island General Laws Section 16-7-44 Authorizing The Issuance Of $5,900,000 Bonds By The Town Of Smithfield To Finance Health, Safety And Fire Code Related Emergency Repairs, Alterations, Renovations, Improvements And Equipping Of School Facilities In The Town And All Attendant Expenses And Approving The Issuance Of Bonds And Notes Pursuant To Financing Agreements With The Rhode Island Health And Educational Building Corporation
1051.description: Empowers Smithfield to issue general obligation bonds not to exceed $5,900,000 to finance health, safety, and fire code repairs to school facilities. This act would take effect upon approval of the question by a majority of voters in the general election.

1055.title: Rhode Island Human Resources Investment Council
1055.description: Makes a minor revision to the state work immersion program to include recent college graduates.

1056.title: Relating To Term Lengths For Elected Officials In The City Of Warwick
1056.description: Relating To Term Lengths For Elected Officials In The City Of Warwick

1057.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Nefl, Inc.
1057.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Nefl, Inc.

1060.title: Adoption Of Children
1060.description: Permits a petition for adoption to be filed by a grandparent(s) without the non-custodial parents' consent when the child is in the sole custody of the grandparent(s).

1062.title: Warren Reevaluation
1062.description: Change the date of the next property revaluation in the town of Warren to 2016.

1063.title: Relating To To Create The Bristol County Water Authority And To Provide For Its Powers And Duties
1063.description: Provide the Bristol County Water Authority with the authority to appoint a secretary and treasurer.

1064.title: Litter Control And Recycling
1064.description: Provides that 30% of any fine for littering collected pursuant to a complaint filed by a local law enforcement agency would inure to the benefit of that agency, with remittances to be made not less often than once every 3 months.

1066.title: Workers' Compensation - General Provisions
1066.description: Provides for various changes to the jurisdiction, procedure, and administration of the Rhode Island workers' compensation court.

1067.title: Sewer Authority
1067.description: Make a number of changes to the enabling act for the Warwick Sewer Authority.

1071.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Audette Realty Corporation
1071.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Audette Realty Corporation

1072.title: Relating To Revenue Protection
1072.description: Provides changes in the allocation of net terminal income at Newport Grand and subjects Newport Grand to table game enforcement laws.

1075.title: Mortgage Foreclosure And Sale
1075.description: Amends the law requiring a mortgagee to participate in good faith in a mediation conference prior to initiating foreclosure proceedings and would also repeal the law requiring mortgagees to send a notice advising mortgagors of the right to counseling.

1076.title: Authorizing State-operated Casino Gaming At Newport Grand Subject To Statewide And Local Voter Approval
1076.description: Authorizes a voter referendum on the approval of state-operated casino gaming at Newport Grand and expansion thereto which expansion shall be subject to state and local voter approval.

1077.title: Mobile And Manufactured Homes
1077.description: Provide that boards or commissions with governing powers over mobile and manufactured homes offer fair and impartial elections, and to ensure transparency in the election process.

1081.title: Authorizing The City Of Newport To Finance The Design, Acquisition, Demolition, Construction, Repair, Rehabilitation, Improvement, Alteration, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of Municipal Facilities For School, Recreation, Library And Other Public Uses By The Issuance Of Not More Than $6,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor
1081.description: Authorizes the city of Newport to issue not more than $6,000,000 bonds for municipal facilities.

1084.title: Woonsocket Tax Amnesty Periods
1084.description: Authorize the city of Woonsocket to adopt by ordinance tax amnesty periods during its 2015 fiscal year.

1087.title: Human Services - Youth Pregnancy And At-risk Prevention Services Program
1087.description: Creates a youth pregnancy and at-risk prevention services program to be administered by the department of human services. The director of the department will make an annual allocation of $250,000 through federal funds.

1090.title: Employer Contributions
1090.description: Prevent employers from paying a higher contribution toward their workers' unemployment compensation benefits account fund if any one of their workers has more than one job.

1091.title: Retirement Of Municipal Employees -- Town Of Middletown
1091.description: Provides that Middletown full-time civilian dispatchers and employees not affiliated with a union, hired after June 30, 2012, shall be enrolled in a (403(b) or equivalent plan.

1092.title: Relating To Authorizing The Town Of Lincoln To Establish That The Lincoln Water Commission Is A Department Of The Town
1092.description: This act authorizes the town of Lincoln to establish the Lincoln Water Commission as a department of the town.

1093.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
1093.title: Relating To Towns And Cities-wastewater Management Districts
1093.description: Authorize connection to existing sanitary sewer lines from facilities across city and town lines under certain circumstances.

1094.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of K & K Realty, Inc.
1094.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of K & K Realty, Inc.

1095.title: Workers' Compensation Insurance Fund
1095.description: Eliminates the workers compensation insurance premium surcharge of triple the premiums for high risk employees and would prevent a low hazard employer from paying premiums based on the place of employment and not the work performed.

1096.title: Tents--grandstands--air-supported Structures
1096.description: Allows tents up to 350 sq. ft. on public commercial land without need for license unless required by fire code, exempts tents for one/two family dwellings from fire marshal jurisdiction, requires training of deputy fire marshals to ensure enforcement.

1097.title: Mayoral Academies And Charter Schools
1097.description: Exempt the town of West Warwick from complying with the statutory requirements of chapters 77, 77.1, 77.2, 77.3 and 77.4 of title 16 regarding a Mayoral Academy, schools, and municipal academies for a five (5) year period.

1099.title: Relating To Education-student Performance
1099.description: Encourages school districts to train their school counselors on collaborating with business, industry and other community organizations to help create internships and apprenticeships.

1100.title: Definitions And General Code Provisions
1100.description: Authorize the use of an antique motor car or motor cycle twenty-five (25) years or older for limited enjoyment in addition to use in exhibitions, club activities, parades, and other functions of public interest.

1102.title: Authorizing The Town Of Cumberland, With The Approval Of The Qualified Electors, To Issue General Obligation Bonds And/or Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $12,500,000 For Construction, Equipping And Furnishing Of A New Public Safety Complex In The Town
1102.description: Authorize the town of Cumberland to issue up to twelve million five hundred thousand dollars ($12,500,000) of general obligation bonds and notes in order to construct, equip and furnish a new public safety complex.

1103.title: Public Corporation Debt Management
1103.description: Prevents the legislature, state and any quasi-governmental entity to issue moral obligation bonds without voter approval.

1104.title: Authorizing The Town Of Cumberland, With The Approval Of The Qualified Electors, To Issue General Obligation Bonds And/or Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $2,500,000 For The Repair And Rehabilitation Of Road Infrastructure In The Town
1104.description: Authorize the town of Cumberland to issue up to two million five hundred thousand dollars ($2,500,000) of general obligation bonds and notes in order to finance the repair and rehabilitation of road infrastructure.

1106.title: In Accordance With Rhode Island General Laws Section 16-7-44 Approving The Issuance Of Not To Exceed $10,000,000 Lease Revenue Bonds Or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness By The Providence Public Buildings Authority To Provide Funding For "warm, Safe And Dry" Health And Safety Projects In Providence Public Schools
1106.description: Serves as the enabling act required by RIGL § 16-7-44 in order for the bonds or evidences of indebtedness issued by the Prov Public Bldgs Authority in support of Providence school housing projects to be eligible for state housing aid reimbursement.

1109.title: Comprehensive Community - Police Relationship Act Of 2014
1109.description: Enact the "Comprehensive Community-Police Relationship Act of 2014".

1111.title: Funeral Service Establishments
1111.description: Specify that the surviving custodial parent(s) of the deceased person would have the authority to make funeral arrangements for any deceased child in the event that no agent, surviving spouse, domestic partner are living at the time of death.

1112.title: Hospital Charges
1112.description: Require all RI hospitals to annually compile a list of the average charges for 25 most commonly performed outpatient and inpatient procedures and to submit these lists to the department of health.

1115.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices, And Other State Constructions
1115.description: Name the Boston Neck Road Bridge over Route 138 in North Kingstown the "Second Lieutenant Matthew Coutu Memorial Bridge."

1120.title: Relating To Exempting From Taxation The Real And Personal Property Of Ywca Rhode Island
1120.description: Exempt from taxation the property of YWCA Rhode Island, a nonprofit corporation.

1121.title: In Amendment Of To Incorporate The Westerly Cemetery Company As Amended
1121.description: Amend the provisions of the act of incorporation of the Westerly Cemetery Company Crow River Bend Cemetery Company pertaining to the board of trustees.

1122.title: Child Advocate Office
1122.description: Create an advisory committee to the office of the child advocate.

1123.title: Appeals
1123.description: Remove the existing probate court appellate requirement that an appellant file with the superior court all relevant probate court filings, exhibits and transcripts.

1124.title: Statewide Referenda Elections
1124.description: Requires that for the next general election, certain questions regarding bonds and expenditures of funds, be prepared by the secretary of state with only the caption and financial obligation, but that the question be listed in the voting booth.

1125.title: Governor's Workforce Board Rhode Island
1125.description: Substitutes the Rhode Island Human Resource Investment Council with the Governor's Workforce Board Rhode Island creating the principal workforce policy body for the state.

1532.description: Establish the RI Social Impact Bond pilot program and study commission within the department of administration

1533.title: Eliminating Excise Tax For Qualified Electric Plug-in Drive Vehicles
1533.description: Exempt qualified electric plug-in drive vehicles from excise taxes

1540.title: Motor Vehicle Excise Tax
1540.description: Provide reimbursement to the cities and towns for the motor vehicle excise tax based on the percentage of respective values in each city and town, rather than the tax rates

1554.title: Income Tax Refunds - State Tax Officials
1554.description: Give all state income tax return filers the option to have their tax refund directly deposited into their bank account

1555.title: Medicaid Fraud And Waste Prevention
1555.description: Implement fraud and waste detection and reduction solutions within the state Medicaid, RIte Care and RIte Share programs

1557.title: Gender Rating
1557.description: Provide that insurance companies shall not vary the premium rates charged for a health coverage plan based on the gender of the individual policy holder, enrollee, subscriber, or member

1560.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1560.title: Raw Milk
1560.description: Establish procedures and standards promulgated by the milk commission for the handling and sale of raw milk in the state

1563.title: General Powers--registration Of Businesses In Richmond
1563.description: Authorize the town of Richmond to enact an ordinance providing for the registration of businesses in the town. The act would also provide a fine of up to ($25.00) per month for failing to register, not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300.00).

1564.title: Immigration Status
1564.description: Prohibit a landlord from asking about the immigration status of a prospective tenant.

1567.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure--courts
1567.description: Require a sign language or communication access realtime translation (CART) provider for many court proceedings

1570.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1570.title: Registration Of Voters
1570.description: Allow a voter to change his or her party affiliation on or before the twenty ninth (29th) day preceding any primary election for which the voter is eligible

1571.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1571.title: Elective Meetings
1571.description: Create a process for in-person early voting before the actual election day

1573.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1573.title: Hunting And Hunting Safety
1573.description: Change the maximum size of shotgun shells a person may have on his or her possession while hunting from a number two (no. 2) shot to a 00 ("double-aught") shot

1580.title: Certified School Teachers' Arbitration
1580.description: Prohibit any municipality which has a locally administered pension plan in "critical status" from entering into labor contracts under this chapter exceeding five (5) years

1581.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1581.title: Workers' Compensation Benefits
1581.description: Repeal the section of the RI General Laws relating to continuation of workers' compensation benefits for partial incapacity

1585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1585.title: Work On Holidays And Sundays
1585.description: Allow a RI employer some flexibility to reschedule the observance of state holidays that Congress doesn't recognize as national public holidays

1586.title: State Workforce Investment Board
1586.description: Legislatively establish a state workforce investment board consisting of 19 members appointed by the governor with the advise and consent of the Senate, formerly created by executive order 05-18 dated September 22, 2005

1587.title: Uniform Commercial Driver's License Act
1587.description: Amend the requirements necessary to issue a tank endorsement under this section

1589.title: The Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices, And Other State Constructions
1589.description: Rename the bridge in the city of Providence known as the I-195 Providence River Bridge: No. 1181. It shall hereafter be named and known as the William D. Warner Memorial Bridge

1596.title: Board Of Education Organizational Structure
1596.description: Establish a permanent governance structure for the Rhode Island board of education

1601.title: Performance Audits Of Governmental Entities
1601.description: Require independent performance audits to be conducted periodically by the state auditor general

1605.title: Electronic Vehicle Manufacturing Tax Credit Act
1605.description: Create a tax credit for electronic vehicle manufacturers capped at 6% based upon the aggregate amount of new employment during each taxable year commencing July 1, 2014

1614.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1614.title: Limited Guardianship And Guardianship Of Adults
1614.description: Require that guardians file Durable Power of Attorney for Health Care and/or a living will within thirty (30) days of their appointment, and they are bound to carry out this document

1615.title: Corrections Department
1615.description: Include interest earned on moneys held in a prisoner’s account as part of the prisoner’s funds to be turned over upon release from the prison

1621.title: Apprenticeship
1621.description: Require that all bidders responding to an invitation to bid on a public works project would have an apprenticeship program, and that no less than 15% of the project's labor hours be performed by apprentices in this program

1633.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
1633.title: Drinking Water Supply System Protection
1633.description: Classifies the two (2) types of water quality protection funds and designates who administers the funds deposited therein.

1647.title: The Rhode Island College Internship Tax Credit Act
1647.description: Create the Rhode Island College Internship Tax Credit Act

1648.title: Health Care For Families
1648.description: Expand the income disregards or other methodology for parents or relative caretakers eligible for medical assistance under this chapter to income levels that are below 185% of the federal poverty level

1651.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1651.title: Department Of Environmental Management - User Fees
1651.description: Allow the host municipality to share in all beach parking fee receipts, not just daily parking fee receipts

1660.title: Water Supply Protection Charge
1660.description: Impose sales and use tax on the "Water Supply Protection Charge" previously imposed on water bills

1661.title: Plan Review Fees
1661.description: Provide that a portion of the fees generated by plan review applications under the fire code be used to fund the cost of professional services and training education

1679.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1679.title: Aerial Privacy Protection Act
1679.description: Prohibit law enforcement from using Unmanned Aerial Vehicles without a proper warrant

1681.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1681.title: Attorney's Fees
1681.description: Authorize a court, in a breach of contract lawsuit, to award attorney’s fees to the successful defendant

1688.title: Self-service Storage Facilities
1688.description: Remove the requirement that the owner of storage space give notice to an occupant by publication in a newspaper of general circulation

1699.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1699.title: Conduct Of Election/voting Equipment And Supplies
1699.description: Add additional photo-identification documents as acceptable proof of identity for voters as well as additional identification documents with or without a photograph as acceptable proof of identity for voters at all state and local elections

1701.title: Department Of Children, Youth, And Families
1701.description: Create a nondiscriminatory clause under the children's bill of rights for all children who are under the supervision of the department of children, youth, and families

1702.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1702.title: Identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
1702.description: Permit certain individuals with a record of two misdemeanor convictions to still be eligible for expungement of those records by redefining the term “first time offender.”

1704.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1704.title: Immigrant Assistance In Crime Fighting
1704.description: Establish the "Immigrant Assistance in Crime Fighting Act" to promote the safety and health of all residents by making it more likely that immigrants would report violations of state and local law

1708.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1708.title: Subcontractor Payment Act
1708.description: Create the subcontractor payment act to provide subcontractors a method to enforce and collect payment for work performed on certain public works contracts

1722.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1722.title: Workers' Compensation --procedure
1722.description: Eliminate the requirement that a non-prejudicial workers' compensation memorandum of agreement contain a listing of the injured worker's earnings.

1723.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1723.title: Workers' Compensation--general Provisions
1723.description: Makes changes to workers' compensation definitions, specific injury benefits and creates an exception for Professional Employer Organizations and temporary employees.

1724.title: Relating Ot Labor And Labor Relations -- Apprenticeship Programs In Trade And Industry
1724.description: Require employers to pay journey persons and apprentices the same wages and benefits pursuant to collective bargaining agreements.

1725.title: Employment Security - Fraud Prevention And Recovery Of Over Payments
1725.description: Enables the department of employment security to recover all overpayments made due to claimant's fraud and imposes duties relative to notice and determination of benefits or eligibility for waiting period credits on the director of labor and training.

1733.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1733.title: Certification Of Teachers
1733.description: Allow individuals with 2 or more years of a college to serve as substitute teachers for no more than forty (40) teaching days in any one assignment during a school year, This limitation may be extended by the commission.

1734.title: Captioning Of Electronic Video Materials
1734.description: Require manufacturers or publishers of instructional programs for educational institutions to supply them with open or closed captions.

1736.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1736.title: Qualifications Of Teacher Assistants
1736.description: Provide that non-certified teacher assistants and special education teacher assistants would not be subject to the same laws, standards, policies, procedures, and rules that govern certified teachers.

1754.title: Retirement System-- Contributions And Benefits
1754.description: Cap lifetime benefits awarded to retired state and municipal employees and retired teachers to highest salary level achieved during the 3 year period prior to retirement.

1758.title: Relating To Taxation-personal Income Tax
1758.description: Subtract state tax refunds, paid to an individual in the previous year, from federal adjusted gross income, for the purposes of the state income tax. This act would take effect on January 1, 2015.

1759.title: Department Of Health -- Fees
1759.description: Exempt out-of-state food processers and wholesalers from the five hundred dollar ($500) fee charged food processors, as said processors already pay fees to their respective states to ensure compliance with health laws.

1761.title: Residents - Personal Income Tax
1761.description: Exempt retirement or pension benefits from out-of-state public retirement systems from federal adjusted gross income for the purposes of calculating the Rhode Island income of a resident individual.

1765.title: Capital Development Program
1765.description: Provides for a bond referendum to be held in November 2014, to authorize the issuance of $50,000,000 in bonds for affordable housing.

1775.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1775.title: Relating To Public Finance
1775.description: Require the office of management and budget to prepare an annual report regarding the state’s financial status. This act would also require the secretary of state to produce an annual citizens’ guide to state finances.

1776.title: Tax Credits For Contributions To Scholarship Organizations
1776.description: Increase the maximum tax credit that a business could obtain for contributions to scholarship organizations to $200,000 in any tax year.

1785.title: Relating To Taxation-sales And Use Taxes
1785.description: Require "room resellers" to collect and pay sales and use taxes and hotel taxes to the state tax administrator. Room resellers would include sellers of travel packages. This act would take effect on July 1, 2014.

1787.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1787.title: Relating To Health And Safety -- Equitable Funding For Essential Health Services
1787.description: Establishes funding requirements for child and adult immunization programs and contributions to be made by health care insurers.

1789.title: Relating To Human Services
1789.description: Extend low income childcare benefits until June 30, 2015.

1794.title: Tax Appeals
1794.description: Clarifies method of assessing real property and procedure to appeal an assessment. Changes would apply to tax year 2015 and beyond.

1796.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1796.title: Child Care Assistance
1796.description: Expands the eligibility for subsidized childcare by allowing families with income below 225% of the applicable federal poverty guideline to receive assistance according to the department of human services sliding scale.

1804.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1804.title: Prescription Drug Coverage
1804.description: Requires health insurance plans that provide coverage for Rx drugs using step therapy protocols to provide the prescriber with an override process of such protocols in certain situations and provides limitations on out-of-pocket expenditures for Rx drugs.

1808.title: Assisted Living Residence Act
1808.description: Require assisted living residences to post in public area a copy of its license and other required information.

1810.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1810.title: Office Of Health Policy
1810.description: Create an office of health policy, within the department of administration, whose responsibility it would be to reduce the cost of health care while increasing access to quality health care.

1812.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1812.title: Individual Healthcare Coverage
1812.description: Requires all Rhode Island adults to obtain and maintain health insurance and imposes tax penalties for non-compliance.

1818.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1818.title: Determination Of Need For New Healthcare Equipment And New Institutional Health Services
1818.description: Exempt certain smaller healthcare centers from the requirements of determination of need for new healthcare equipment and services.

1821.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1821.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies - Co-insurance And Deductibles
1821.description: Require healthcare entities or health plans operating in the state to recover all co-insurance and deductible amounts from patients for covered services as required under the insured's health benefit plan.

1828.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1828.title: Global Signature Law
1828.description: Conform the definitions of the powers and duties of certified registered nurse practitioners and physician assistants to the definitions employed by the global signature law.

1829.title: Health Insurance
1829.description: Requires that healthcare providers that include in contracts, the requirement before processing for retroactive termination of eligibility, a healthcare entity must verify there are no outstanding claims on file for the enrollee.

1849.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1849.title: Homeless Shelters
1849.description: Directs the chairperson of the housing resources commission to appoint a 9 member committee to formulate rules, regulations and standards relating to homeless shelters.

1855.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1855.title: Rate Review Act
1855.description: Creates a uniform rate review procedure for considering increases in health or dental insurance rates which requires public meetings and hearings.

1867.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1867.title: Uniformed Controlled Substance Act
1867.description: Authorizes the Traffic Tribunal to seal marijuana conviction records of less than 1 oz. Immediately, And Extends The Period a person can satisfy conditions of a marijuana possession enhanced civil penalty by calculating the penalty from conviction date.

1869.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1869.title: E-911 Uniform Emergency Telephone System Division
1869.description: Directs the E-911 uniform emergency telephone system division to conduct a study of the implications and costs related to the implementation of next-generation emergency telephone communications in Rhode Island.

1870.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1870.title: Department Of Business Regulation
1870.description: Require the department of business regulation to create processes and standards to evaluate the skills and education of foreign-trained professionals.

1872.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1872.title: Commerce Corporation
1872.description: Exempting the commerce corporation from sales taxes collected on materials used in construction, reconstruction rehabilitation projects by removing the restriction of projects approved prior to July 1, 2011.

1877.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1877.title: Childcare Assistance Transition Program
1877.description: Establish the pilot childcare assistance transition program.

1880.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1880.title: Uniform Interstate Depositions And Discovery Act
1880.description: Adopts the Uniform Interstate Depositions and Discovery Act, which sets forth procedures for litigants outside of Rhode Island to have subpoenas issued and to obtain discovery within this state.

1881.title: Litigation Lending Agreements
1881.description: Make litigation loan agreements subject to state interest and usury statutes.

1886.title: Public Use Of Private Lands - Liability Limitations
1886.description: Change the definition of "owner" to exclude the state and municipalities for the purposes of liability limitations relating to public use of private lands.

1894.title: Proceedings In Family Court
1894.description: Require the department of children, youth and families to provide the family court with transition plans and the child would continue under the jurisdiction of the family court until he or she turns twenty-one (21) years of age.

1916.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1916.title: Licensing Of Minors - Eligibility Requirements
1916.description: Requires a high school diploma or equivalent as enrollment with academic and attendance requirements to obtain a driver's license, with a hearing and hardship waiver process.

1928.title: Relating To Fiduciaries
1928.description: Permit the settlor of a revocable trust to provide for a person other than the trustee to direct actions of the trust.

1929.title: Mechanics' Liens
1929.description: Provide the notice under the provisions of the mechanics' lien law maybe provided in a written contract or a separate document incorporated in a written contract prior to or within ten (10) days of commencing physical work or the land.

1940.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1940.title: Willful Trespass, Disorderly Conduct, And Shoplifting
1940.description: Make certain disorderly conduct offenses subject to a fine of $500 only, while maintaining the current sanctions for disorderly conduct offenses involving lascivious purposes and disorderly conduct cases involving domestic violence

1965.title: The Department Of Corrections
1965.description: Add correctional investigators and correctional officers to the definition of “police officer” for the purposes of those public safety officials entitled to payment of full salary if disabled in the line of duty.

1968.title: Joint Committee On Legislative Services
1968.description: Include the majority leader of the senate as a member of the joint committee on legislative services.

1979.title: Coastal Resources Management Council
1979.description: Effective 7/1/14 the transatlantic cable fees for governmental renewable energy projects shall be allocated with DEM getting 33%, CRMC 34% and the energy resources office 33%.

1980.title: The Clean Energy Jobs Program
1980.description: Create a tariff-based renewable energy distributed generation financing program.

2014.title: The Open Contracting Act
2014.description: Prohibits public bodies which are soliciting bids on public works projects from requiring successful bidders to utilize, affiliate with or be exclusively represented by any labor union.

2015.title: Wages
2015.description: Give employees several enhanced ways to help them collect their wages from nonpaying employers, set forth penalties for nonpayment of wages by an employer, and implements the procedure to be followed for filing of claims.

2028.title: Pharmacies--compounded Prescription Labeling
2028.description: Permit a pharmacy to provide a compounded drug to a practitioner for administration in a physician's office.

2038.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2038.title: Arbitration
2038.description: Allows retired police officers and firefighters to file grievances alleging that the contract under which they retired, was violated. The union has the final say on whether to pursue grievance.

2045.title: Weapons -mental Health
2045.description: Remove the term “habitual drunkard” from the list of those prohibited from possessing firearms.

2049.title: The Standard Non-forfeiture Law For Life Insurance
2049.description: Make technical changes to the standard valuation and standard nonforfeiture provisions of the general laws relating to insurance.

2055.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2055.title: Licensed Activities - Lenders And Loan Brokers - Check Cashing
2055.description: Amend the financial institutions statute to separate “check cashing” and “payday lending” licenses into separate license categories. This act would take effect on January 1, 2015.

2061.title: Personal Income Tax - Deductions For Medical Expenses
2061.description: Create an itemized deduction for medical and dental expenses that exceed ten percent (10%) of adjusted gross income. This act would take effect on January 1, 2015.

2072.title: Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses -- Violations
2072.description: Changes first and second criminal offenses for driving with a suspended or expired license to civil violation, reduces the potential monetary penalty and gives sentencing discretion to judge on third and subsequent offenses.

2083.title: Residents
2083.description: Makes changes to the definition of the term "resident" for purposes of the motor vehicle code and includes those who do business in the state or intrastate or declares Rhode Island his or her residence.

2084.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Patent Infringement
2084.description: Authorizes Attorney General to file as bad faith patent infringement suit for equitable, monetary relief, costs, fees, attorney's fees and exemplary damages.

2085.title: Abortion Anti-coercion Act
2085.description: Requires facilities which perform abortions to post a conspicuous notice informing patients that abortions require free and voluntary consent without coercion.

2086.title: Human Resource Investment Council
2086.description: Sets reimbursement rates for participating in the non-trade apprenticeship program and permits the human resource development council to establish rules and regulations for the program.

2093.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2093.title: Code Of Ethics
2093.description: Require that appointments to the Rhode Island ethics commission be made with the advice and consent of the senate. The act would also establish qualifications for appointment of members to the commission.

2095.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2095.title: Mail Ballots
2095.description: Allow the board of elections to announce meetings to count mail ballots on website rather than in newspaper, and make several technical changes.

2104.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2104.title: Relating To Corporations, Associations And Partnerships
2104.description: Modernize certain provisions of the limited liability company act in light of changes made to the uniform limited liability act.

2113.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
2113.title: Nonprofit Medical Service Corporations
2113.description: Prohibits group health plans and health insurance issuers from discriminating, concerning plan participation or coverage against any health care provider who is acting within the scope of their license or certification.

2121.title: The Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act
2121.description: Broadens the immunity from prosecution for prosecution afforded under the Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act and repeals its sunset provision.

2124.title: Licenses
2124.description: Require parents or guardians of minors seeking to obtain an operating license to attend a course on the content of driver education curriculum and graduated licensing.

2126.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2126.title: Operators' And Chauffeurs' Licenses - School Bus Driver Annual Training
2126.description: Require school bus driver training to include national highway traffic safety training.

2130.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Silver Lake Pizza, Inc.
2130.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Silver Lake Pizza, Inc.

2131.title: Mobile Telephones
2131.description: Requires advanced mobile communication devices (smartphones) be equipped with technology that can disable the device if stolen.

2142.title: Relating To The Chariho Regional School District
2142.description: Relating To The Chariho Regional School District

2161.title: Consumer Car Information And Choice Act
2161.description: Regulates the generation, collection, analysis, dissemination and sharing of connected care vehicle data and would provide the consumer with notice and protect consumer rights relating to access to and sharing of said connected car vehicle data.

2164.title: Community College Of Rhode Island
2164.description: Create the “Remediation Act of 2014” which would create a pilot program at CCRI for writing remediation and would mandate a report for the proposal on a redesign of the mathematics remediation program.

2165.title: The Cte Re-imagined Act
2165.description: Authorizes the board of education to re-imagine the approach to career and technical education statewide and to implement up to two (2) model sites and appropriate funding for one-time start-up costs.

2168.title: Climate Change
2168.description: Repeal the Rhode Island climate change commission and would create a climate change council in the executive department. It would suggest the impacts of climate change be taken into consideration by department directors.

2169.title: Collector's Permits
2169.description: Enables the director of department of environmental management to monitor special permits to take or possess any species of wild animals.

2188.title: Office Of Health And Human Services
2188.description: Creates a Health and Human Service System Performance Improvement Task Force to establish performance measures expectations and outcomes for the departments in the office of health and human services and to remove the department of health from the OHHS.

2196.title: Rhode Island Public Employee Pension Revocation And Reduction Act
2196.description: Provides the superior court have jurisdiction to adjudicate proceedings initiated pursuant to any municipal ordinance providing for the revocation or reduction of municipal pensions upon conviction of any circumstance constituting dishonorable service.

2200.title: Taxation
2200.description: Reduces the annual business corporation tax from 9% to 7%. Revises reporting requirements for corporations in a combined group or a unitary business.

2202.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of West Warwick Ri Business Trust Ltd.
2202.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of West Warwick Ri Business Trust Ltd.

2203.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Main Street Remainder Business Trust Ltd.
2203.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Main Street Remainder Business Trust Ltd.

2210.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2210.title: Comprehensive Planning And Land Use Act - Moratorium Comprehensive Permit Applications - Charlestown
2210.description: Grant the town of Charlestown a one year moratorium on comprehensive permit applications.

2213.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Rotondo Builders, Inc.
2213.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Rotondo Builders, Inc.

2219.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2219.title: Construction And Maintenance Of Certain Roads In The City Of Providence
2219.description: Requires the state to maintain certain roads in Providence.

2231.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2231.title: - Nursing Education Center Lease Authorization

2243.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Pontiac Village Association, Inc.
2243.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Pontiac Village Association, Inc.

2251.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
2251.title: Durable Medical Equipment Freedom Of Choice – Fair Competition And Practices
2251.description: Authorizes freedom of choice by an insured party in the selection of durable medical equipment.

2262.title: The Rhode Island Infrastructure Authority
2262.description: Establish several new entities and programs to promote a unified statewide approach to updating, renovating, and otherwise improving public school buildings in the state.

2270.title: Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems
2270.description: Prohibit the sale of electronic nicotine delivery systems to persons under eighteen (18) and would require a business selling, dealing or distributing an electronic nicotine delivery system to obtain a license from the department of health.

2289.description: Senate Resolution Expressing Its Deepest Condolences On The Passing Of Mary "auntie Babe" Evangelista
